titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale College Records Concerning its Internship Program
Yale College Records Concerning its Internship Program
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 08:49

did.unittitle: Yale College records concerning its internship program

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of correspondence, reports, applications, resumes, financial records, and histories documenting the activities and operations of the Yale College internship program.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 9-E (YRG 9-E), Records documenting Yale College offices, programs, and projects.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale College Records Concerning its Internship Program (RU 570). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Yale College Internship Program began in 1975 under the directorship of A. Tappan Wilder. The program, which ran in conjunction with Yale Summer Term, placed 25 undergraduates a year in government, business, and media internships during fall or spring term. In 1979 the Yale Summer Program ended, raising questions about the future of the internship program. In the same year Wilder left Yale, and Antonia Stolper, a former intern, was appointed to replace him. Stolper left Yale in 1980. Jean Cahoon took charge of the program, and seven interns were given positions. Information was gathered concerning the p08s~bility of linking the Internship Program to Environmental Studies. In 1981 nine interns were given positions. In 1982 the program went defunct.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of correspondence, reports, applications, resumes, financial records, and histories documenting the activities and operations of the Yale College internship program.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: No online inventory available. Paper inventory available in repository.

The papers are divided into three sections: Office Files, Financial Records, and Student Reports: Office Files contains correspondence by the directors of the program, information on advisory committees and internships, and general information concerning the history and development of the program. Financial Records contains information concerning the disposition of the internship account, and grants offered to the program, as well as invoices and receipts. Student Reports contains the applications, and mid-year and final reports of the interns. Each section is arranged chronologically, and then alphabetically within each year.
